== Main Inclusion Report for libflexmock-ruby ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/libf/libflexmock-ruby/]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures
# ''Rationale:''
** Mock object library for Ruby unit testing
** Build dependency of rake (pending MIR)
0. ''Security:''
** No known CVE entries
** No known Secunia history
** No rooted binaries or daemons
** No network activity whatsoever
** Does not directly (not through a library) process binary (video, audio, etc) or structured (PDF, etc) data
** No known source code reviews available
0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Should always work out of the box
** No debconf questions asked
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:libflexmock-ruby|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>
** <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/libf/libflexmock-ruby.html|Maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki> is calm
** <nowiki>[[http://flexmock.rubyforge.org/|Upstream]]</nowiki> is vigorous
** Does not deal with hardware
** Upstream test suite available, not run at build time
0. ''Standards compliance:''
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliance
** Packaging system cdbs
0. ''Dependencies:''
** ruby-pkg-tools (>= 0.14). ruby1.8, ruby1.9
** ruby-pkg-tools - pending MIR
0. ''Maintenance:''
** Largely takes care of itself (or rather Debian does)
** The debian maintainer is watching over the quality of this package
0. ''Background information:''
** The general purpose and context of the package is clear from the package's debian/control file
** Upstream calls this software flexmock
0. ''Internationalization:''
** non-graphical app
